result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy Lee Robertson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Lee Robertson

8:30 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joel David Schlitz in court for Randy Lee Robertson. Defendant Randy Lee Robertson in court. ADA Ellenwood recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to the AMEND Count 1: Receiving Stolen Property 943.34(1)(a). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses counts 2-4. Sentencing arguments. Victims makes statement. 

Court Orders:
AMENDED Count 1: 

- Fine: $500.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court. 60 days to pay 
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample 
- Restitution: $2,500.- payable to Christ the King Church; Balance to be pd Through Clerk of Court. 

Adjourned at 09:00 AM

Pretrial assessment. arc
Status conference on April 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Boy Scouts of America, the organization and facilites.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Court will find good cause for exceeding time limits due to counsel.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
